Fictional settings in [[The Adventures of Tintin]]:
â   â  
* [[Syldavia]] in the [[Balkans]] is by HergÃ©'s own admission modelled on [[Albania]]<ref>Letter from HergÃ© to Charles Lesne, 12 June 1939, cit. Assouline, Pierre (1996) ''HergÃ©'', Folio (p218)</ref>, and is threatened by neighbouring [[Borduria]] — an attempted annexation appears in ''[[King Ottokar's Sceptre]]'' — this situation parallels respectively [[Czechoslovakia]] or [[Austria]] and expansionist [[Nazi Germany]] prior to [[World War II]]. It is later home to Sprodj Atomic Centre, which launches the first rocket to the moon.
* [[Syldavia]] in the [[Balkans]] is by HergÃ©'s own admission modelled on [[Albania]]<ref>Letter from HergÃ© to Charles Lesne, 12 June 1939, cit. Assouline, Pierre (1996) ''HergÃ©'', Folio (p218)</ref>, and is threatened by neighbouring [[Borduria]] — an attempted annexation appears in ''[[King Ottokar's Sceptre]]'' — this situation parallels respectively [[Czechoslovakia]] or [[Austria]] and expansionist [[Nazi Germany]] prior to [[World War II]]. It is later home to Sprodj Atomic Centre, which launches the first rocket to the moon.
